overview.description: Import and export data for migration, backup, integration, and reporting purposes
overview.whatItDoes: Bulk data operations including importing records from external sources and exporting system data for analysis or backup
overview.whyItMatters: Efficient data migration saves time during implementation. Regular exports provide backup and enable external analysis. Incorrect imports can corrupt system data.
keyBenefits: Bulk data migration from legacy systems
overview.criticalNote: ⚠️ Import operations modify production data. Always test with small batches first.

import-data.title: Import Data
import-data.description: Bulk import records from Excel, CSV, or other supported formats
steps: Navigate to Data I/O > Import tab
Select entity type to import (Cases, Clients, Hearings, etc.)
Download the import template for that entity
Fill data following template structure exactly
Validate data in your spreadsheet first
Map source columns to system fields
tips: Always use official templates - custom formats may fail
Test with 5-10 records before full import
Clean data before import (remove duplicates, fix formatting)
Import during low-usage hours for large datasets
warnings: Import cannot be undone easily - backup first
Duplicate records may be created if matching isn't configured
Large imports can take significant time - don't close browser
validationRules: Reference fields must match existing master data
Unique fields (like GSTIN) cannot duplicate existing records

export-data.title: Export Data
export-data.description: Download system data for backup, analysis, or external use
steps: Navigate to Data I/O > Export tab
Set date range or other filters
tips: Use filters to keep export files manageable
Excel for human review, CSV for system integration
Include system IDs if re-importing later
Regular exports provide informal backup

formats.excel: Best for review and analysis, preserves formatting
formats.csv: Best for system integration, universal compatibility
formats.json: Best for API integration, preserves data structure

map-fields.title: Configure Field Mapping
map-fields.description: Define how source data columns map to system fields
steps: After uploading import file, mapping screen appears
Mark fields as 'Skip' if not needed
tips: Name columns in source file to match system fields
Save mapping templates for repeated imports
Check sample data in preview to verify mapping

validate-import.title: Validate Import Data
validate-import.description: Check data for errors before committing import
steps: System checks all rows for errors
Fix errors in source file or skip problem rows
Re-upload and validate if fixes needed
Proceed to import when validation passes
errorTypes: Required field missing - must be filled
Reference not found - master data lookup failed
Data type mismatch - text in number field, etc.
tips: Address errors in source file for cleanest import
Skip rows only for truly optional records
Export validation report for documentation

schedule-export.title: Schedule Automated Exports
schedule-export.description: Set up recurring data exports for backup or integration
steps: Set delivery method (Download, Email, Cloud Storage)
Set retention period for stored exports
tips: Use for regular backups to external storage
Weekly exports for audit documentation
Email delivery for stakeholder reports

import-history.title: View Import History
import-history.description: Track all import operations for audit and troubleshooting
steps: Navigate to Data I/O > History tab
Filter by date, entity type, or user
tips: Check history when investigating data issues
Error reports help identify problem patterns
Original files preserved for accountability

beforeImport: Back up current data via export

commonMistakes.mistake: Importing without testing small batch first
commonMistakes.impact: Widespread data issues discovered too late
commonMistakes.prevention: Always test with 5-10 records, verify in system, then proceed

commonMistakes.mistake: Using wrong date format in source file
commonMistakes.impact: Dates import incorrectly or fail validation
commonMistakes.prevention: Check system date format, use explicit formatting in Excel

commonMistakes.mistake: Not backing up before large import
commonMistakes.impact: Cannot recover if import corrupts data
commonMistakes.prevention: Export relevant data before any significant import
Address all warnings, skip only intentionally

staff.restrictions: Cannot import or export team/all data
staff.tips: Use exports for personal productivity analysis

manager.permissions: Can run imports for own team scope
manager.tips: Verify team data quality via regular exports

admin.permissions: All entity types, all scopes, scheduling
admin.tips: Set up automated backup exports, document all imports

implementor.tips: Create mapping templates, document transformation rules

faqs.question: Can I undo an import?
faqs.answer: Not automatically. You need to identify imported records and delete them manually, or restore from backup. This is why testing with small batches is critical.

faqs.question: Why does my import keep timing out?
faqs.answer: Large files may exceed processing limits. Split into smaller batches (1000-5000 records). Also check network stability.

faqs.question: How do I update existing records via import?
faqs.answer: Include the system ID column in your import file. The system will match by ID and update existing records instead of creating new ones.
